article.headline: Charlotte 85, Valparaiso 77
article.story: VALPARAISO, Ind. (AP) -- Brendan Plavich scored 21 points, all of them on 3-pointers, to lead Charlotte to an 85-71 victory over Valparaiso on Saturday night. Curtis Withers scored 16 points, making 7-of-10 free throws, and E.J. Drayton added 15 for Charlotte. The 49ers trailed by as many as 5 points in the first half before a Chris Sager 3-pointer broke a tie to put them ahead for good, 28-25, with 7:16 left in the half. After leading 51-42 at the break, Charlotte (2-1) held a double-digit edge for most of the rest of the way. The 49ers dominated from the floor, shooting 52 percent (30-of-58), while the Crusaders managed only 42 percent (25-of-59) for the night. Jimmie Miles scored a game-high 22 points for Valparaiso (0-3), while Dan Oppland added 12 and Kenny Harris 10. Led by Plavich's 7 3-pointers, the 49ers dominated from 3-point range, hitting 69 percent (9-of-13), while Valparaiso could manage only 38 percent (5-of-13).
